result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard K Stensrud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

10/22/15 Sentencing hearing.
Letter to Judge from Defendant regarding sentencing.

Defendant Richard K Stensrud in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Richard K Stensrud in custody.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense makes corrections to PSI. Letter from Defendant filed with the Court. State makes recommendation. Defense makes argument. Defendant makes statement. 

Court relates and orders:

Count 1: 8 years Prison with initial confinement of 3 yrs and 0 months and 5 years extended supervision
Credit for 212 days jail served.

Count 2: 8 years Prison with initial confinement of 3 yrs and 0 months and 5 years extended supervision - concurrent with Count 1.

Defendant is not eligible for the challenge incarceration program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse program.

Dodge Correctional as reception site.

Conditions of extended supervision:
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. 
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
Court costs on both counts including the $200.00 buy money
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
